discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer should be deduplication:
SAN policies can be set to compress data written to the RAID array using techniques such as data deduplication, which reduces duplicate data blocks to single occurrences.
Deduplication removes duplicate disk blocks and replaces duplicates with pointers to reduce disk space consumption.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the cloud storage technology that would allow a company with 12 nearly identical servers to have the SMALLEST storage footprint?

discussion.content: No it is Iaas Infrastructure is the backend systems and must be patched and maintained by the cloud provider

Selected Answer: D
Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is a cloud computing framework that delivers virtualized computing resources via the internet. This model enables organizations to lease IT infrastructure, including servers, storage, networking, and virtualization capabilities, on a pay-per-use basis, eliminating the need for the purchase and upkeep of physical hardware.

comments.content:
thinking it better, i think this question is hard to understand.
It is trying to say what model satisfied that need, so now the cloud provider should do that.
Answer would be A (SAAS)
Wrong. What SaaS product can you think of that requires YOU to patch/maintain it?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I think infraestructure as a service is correct.
In PAAS and SAAS is the cloud provider that manages the software.
In IAAS it is the customer.
I read it as the cloud team requires You to patch and update

The answer is 100% wrong. It must be A (SaaS)
Source: CompTIA official study guide book

questions.question_text: The cloud consumer compliance team requires the IT department to patch and update cloud resources properly. Which of the following cloud service delivery models will BEST suit this need?

comments.content: Agree, it did the same calculations and it's the same result B) 1,800

discussion.content:
Answer 'B' Correct-
3 servers for 9 months = 3x200x9 = $5400
1 server for 12 months = 1x200x12=$2400
Current estimated cost = $5400+$2400 = $7800.
CSP offers flat $1500 for each instance for a year, so for 4 instances = $1500x4=$6000.
So, Savings = $7800-$6000=$1800.
B is correct. It is all four not three.
Should be A. ($200 x 9 - $1500) x 3 set.

questions.question_text:
An organization plans to keep three of its cloud servers online for another nine months and a fourth server online for a year. The current pricing is $200 per month per server. The cloud provider announced the sale price of $1,500 per year per reserved instance.
Which of the following represents the cost savings by converting all four of the cloud servers to reserved instances?

comments.content: "reporting increased cloud costs" This means they have been billed/charged for it. If they have been billed/charged, then it won't be Showback and thus it should be Chargeback.

discussion.content:
Isn't it C) Showback 
Because showback can calculate the operating costs based on business unit. Chargeback is actually charging a business department for what they haved used. Correct me if I'm wrong please

questions.question_text: A company's finance team is reporting increased cloud costs against the allocated cloud budget. Which of the following is the BEST approach to match some of the cloud operating costs with the appropriate departments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
D - Logs will give you the "documentation" the investigation will need. An SOP will not help provide any evidence of phishing...

In my opinion the SOP is already considered means that inside the SOP there is a certain procedure on how to conduct and start the investigation, so that next is to go on Audits and Log tracings. Just my 2 cents.
Answer D is correct, because it should be part of Standard Operting Procedure
